full_text: Screened by NARA, 6/29/2023 SUITE No. 5 MILLER 3-1793 MONTALVO GROWERS ASSOCIATION 433 EAST MAIN STREET VENTURA, CALIFORNIA December 11, 1961 American Consulate Mexico City, Mexico Gentlemen: We understand that RAFAEL SANCHEZ VEGA will apply at your Consulate for an immigrant visa. In this connection we can inform you that he will be promptly employed by Grower Members of this Association once he has legally immigrated to the United States. He will be employed by the growers as a lemon picker on a piece work basis. Pickers are averaging from $1.00 to $1.10 per hour. Work should be available on the average of 40 hours per week throughout the year. Board and lodging will be available at $1.75 per day. The employment offered by the growers is of a permanent nature and is made in good faith. This offer of employment on behalf of the growers is made to Mr. RAFAEL SANCHEZ VEGA because he has had experience as a contract worker in this area, and has proven his qualification to perform the work involved. Knowledge of the English language is not required. We do our banking with the Ventura Branch of the Bank of America National Trust & Savings Association, Ventura, California. Yours very truly, MONTALVO GROWERS ASSOCIATION By Assistant Secretary Subscribed and sworn to before me this 12 day of the , 1961. Notary Public R. C. MEMILLAN My Commission Expires Nov. 4. 1965
